Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves.Matrix
public class Matrix extends Object
The Matrix class is used to represent matrix objects. Has basic operations such as adding, subtracting, and multiplying (w/ scalars and another matrix), but also includes an implementation of gaussian elimination with partial pivoting and row operations

  • Constructor Summary

      public static double[][] deepCopy(double[][] copyMatrix)
      This creates a copy of a 2D Array of doubles that references entirely new memory locations from the original 2D Array of doubles, so no issues with mutability.
      Parameters:
      copyMatrix - the 2D Array of doubles to copy
      Returns:
      returns a deep copy of the input Array

      Adds a row to another row that is scaled by a scalar
      Parameters:
      srcRow - row to add
      destRow - row to add to
      scalar - a scalar that multiplies the elements to be added

    • rref

      public static Matrix[] rref(Matrix matrix, Matrix augment)
      Perform gaussian elimination on a matrix and its augment to achieve a row-reduced echelon form (hence RREF)
      Parameters:
      matrix - a matrix of MxN size
      augment - an augment matrix that has the same number of rows as the matrix
      Returns:
      a 1d array of two matrices --the first element is the matrix, the second element is the augment matrix; rref([A|B])
